text.0: though holding many gifts for men he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer.
text.1: agni is now the treasurelord of treasures for ever granting all immortal bounties.
text.2: the gods infallible all searching found not him the dear babe who still is round about us.
text.3: worn weary following his track devoted they reached the lovely highest home of agni.
text.4: because with holy oil the pure ones agni served thee the very pure three autumn seasons.
text.5: therefore they won them holy names for worship and nobly born they dignified their bodies.
text.6: making them known to spacious earth and heaven the holy ones revealed the powers of rudra.
text.7: the mortal band discerning in the distance found agni standing in the loftiest station.
text.8: nigh they approached oneminded with their spouses kneeling to him adorable paid worship.
text.9: friend finding in his own friends eye protection they made their own the bodies which they chastened.
text.10: soon as the holy beings had discovered the thriceseven mystic things contained within thee.
text.11: with these oneminded they preserve the amṛta guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle.
text.12: thou agni knower of mens works hast sent us good food in constant course for our subsistence.
text.13: thou deeply skilled in paths of gods becamest an envoy never wearied offeringbearer.
text.14: knowing the law the seven strong floods from heaven full of good thought discerned the doors of riches.
text.15: saramā found the cattles firmbuilt prison whereby the race of man is still supported.
text.16: they who approached all noble operations making a path that leads to life immortal.
text.17: to be the birds support the spacious mother aditi and her great sons stood in power.
text.18: when gods immortal made both eyes of heaven they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory.
text.19: now they flow forth like rivers set in motion they knew the red steeds coming down o agni.
